messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (02:49): hmm, https://datatracker.ietf.org/ipr/942/
f4f1003ab53840254ccb8af51c1e02b3 (02:51): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: got a q about the ApplicationCache interface
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:52): shot
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:52): shoot even
f4f1003ab53840254ccb8af51c1e02b3 (02:52): about the item method
f4f1003ab53840254ccb8af51c1e02b3 (02:52): "The item(index) method must return the dynamic entries with index index from the application cache, if one is associated with the ApplicationCache object."
f4f1003ab53840254ccb8af51c1e02b3 (02:52): what does it return? the URL?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:53): please hold
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:54): yeah, url. that's not clear. send mail?
84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7 (02:57): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I was pretty sure that it was URL but I figured it never hurts if the spec is clear on what it is >(
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:58): yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:58): i dunno why i left it so vague
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:58): that's terrible
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:58): i guess it is just a first draft :-)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (03:00): hmm, someone needs to repost the "cookie" issue indeed
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (03:00): thought it was a non-issue
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:01): i don't understand what the issue _is_ exactly
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:01): though i agree there's an issue
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:02): without really understanding what the issue is, though, i can't easily fix the spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:02): or rather, propose fixes to the spec, since i'm not the editor of that one :-)
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (03:05): I think the issue is fear
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (03:05): and I am not saying that to be demeaning
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (03:05): fear when exposing new network capabilities to web content is very healthy
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:05): i don't exactly understand the fear, so it's not clear to me how to resolve it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:06): it seems like there are as many reasons to send cookies as to not send cookies, and that there is fear in both directions
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:06): so we need to clearly look at what the various fears _are_, and work out how to mitigate them
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:06): while still addressing all the important use cases

fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (03:09): are some of the Mozilla people most interested in this local to the bay area? perhaps this is the sort of issue where informal chat in person + whiteboard could crystallize a lot of the issues
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:15): i'd very open to attending any meeting on a specific issue around here if someone wants to organise it
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:16): I don't know who the relevant mozilla people are
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:16): I guess I can ask sicking
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (03:28): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c_: dveditz, a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9, sicking at least
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (03:29): all @mozilla.com for email (and IRC)
a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (03:30): you also want window, who i think was the one arguing most strongly for not sending cookies (or postponing support until we're more sure that it's safe)
a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (03:31): we're all local to the bay area
a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (03:33): shaver might be interested. he's not local but he's visiting mountain view this week.
a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (03:35): window's schedule is probably the most constrained
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (03:36): I'll see what I can do
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (03:36): some of Apple's security guys may be interested
a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (03:36): a guy from HP, tyler close, came to the meeting at mozilla a month or so ago
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:58): finally gets around to reading the day's math stuff
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:58): people seem to massively underestimate the cost of 140 new elements in the parser
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:59): especially given that they want all 140 of those elements to be ignored...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:01): william's proposed syntax isn't too bad
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:04): hsivonen: embedded content mathml is more like longdesc than external download links for content mathml -- those would be more like [D] links
